meanings.definition: A small enclosure or cage for poultry.
meanings.sent1: The chickens huddled together in the coop during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The farmer built a new coop for his growing flock of hens.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rooster bring a deck of cards into the coop? To play chicken poker!
meanings.sent4: The coop was like a bustling city for the feathered residents.
meanings.sent5: The coop smelled of fresh hay and clucking chickens.

meanings.definition: To confine in a small space.
meanings.sent1: The cat tried to coop up the mouse in the corner.
meanings.sent2: Please don't coop the puppies in the tiny room for too long.
meanings.sent3: The magician managed to coop up the audience inside a giant hat!
meanings.sent4: Her fear seemed to coop her in a cage of anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The students felt cooped up in the crowded classroom.

meanings.sent1: The local farmers formed a coop to sell their produce together.
meanings.sent2: Being part of a coop allows businesses to pool their resources.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cow join the coop? To be part of a mooo-ving team!
meanings.sent4: The coop functioned like a well-oiled machine, with everyone working together.
meanings.sent5: The coop members shared profits and responsibilities equally.
